snippet: The story of how Hungarians wound up deeply in debt in Swiss francs is partly a story of European overconfidence during the boom before the credit crisis. But it is also a story of how poor regulation of banks can be disastrous.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column describes how Hungarians wound up deeply in debt in Swiss francs; maintains that story is partly one of European overconfidence during boom that preceded the credit crisis, but is also one of how poor regulation of banks can be disastrous.

byline.contributor: Helene Bienvenu contributed reporting and Palko Karasz contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The story of how Hungarians wound up deeply in debt in Swiss francs is partly a story of European overconfidence during the boom before the credit crisis. But it is also a story of how poor regulation of banks can be disastrous.

headline.print_headline: Borrowers in Hungary Learn Tough Lessons
